text: This Is Me... Then is the third studio album by American singer and entertainer Jennifer Lopez. It was released in November 2002. The album debuted at number six on Billboard 200. t has sold 2.5 million copies in the United States and over five million copies worldwide. On November 26, 2022, Lopez announced a sequel to the album called This Is Me... Now due to be released February 16, 2024. == Track listing == ;Notes *"Still" contains elements of "Set Me Free", as written by LeRoy Bell and Casey James and performed by Teddy Pendergrass. *"Loving You" contains: **a portion of "Juicy Fruit", as written by James Mtume and performed by Mtume. **an interpolation of "Never Give Up on a Good Thing", as written by Michael Garvin and Tom C. Shapiro and performed by George Benson. *"I'm Glad" contains a sample of "P.S.K. What Does It Mean?", as written and performed by Jesse "Schoolly D" Weaver Jr. *"The One" and "The One (Version 2)" contain an interpolation of "You Are Everything", as written by Thom Bell and Linda Creed and performed by The Stylistics. *"All I Have" contains a sample of "Very Special", as written by Lisa Peters and William Jeffrey and performed by Debra Laws. *"Jenny from the Block" contains: **an interpolation of "Hi-Jack" (1975), as written by Jose Fernando Arbex Miro. **a portion of "South Bronx" (1987), as written by Lawrence Parker and Scott Sterling. **portions of "Heaven and Hell Is on Earth" (1975), as written by Michael Oliver. *"You Belong to Me" contains a sample of "Catch the Beat", as written by G. Andrews, K. Nix, Brad Osborne, T. Ski Valley and performed by T. Ski Valley. *"Baby I Love U!" contains an interpolation of "Midnight Cowboy" (1969), as written and performed by John Barry. == Charts == Chart (2002) Peak position Australian ARIA Albums Chart 14 Belgian Ultratop 50 Albums (Flanders) 6 Belgian Ultratop 50 Albums (Wallonia) 6 Canadian Albums Chart 5 Dutch Albums Chart 4 European Top 100 Albums 3 French SNEP Albums Chart 4 German Albums Chart 4 Japanese Oricon Albums Chart 9 Norwegian Albums Chart 13 Swiss Albums Chart 3 Chart (2003) Peak position Austrian Albums Chart 7 Danish Albums Chart 13 Finnish Albums Chart 10 Hungarian Mahasz Albums Chart 9 Irish Albums Chart 15 Italian FIMI Albums Chart 11 New Zealand RIANZ Albums Chart 19 Polish Albums Chart 19 Portuguese Albums Chart 22 Swedish Albums Chart 7 UK Albums Chart 13 U.S. Billboard 200 2 U.S. Billboard Top R&B;/Hip-Hop Albums 5 U.S. Billboard Top Internet Albums 2 ===Certifications=== Territory Certifier Certification Sales Australia ARIA Platinum 70,000 Austria IFPI Gold 10,000 Belgium Gold 15,000 Canada CRIA 2× platinum 200,000 Europe IFPI Platinum 1,000,000 Finland Gold 19,998 France SNEP 2× gold 320,000 Germany IFPI Gold 100,000 Hungary Mahasz Gold 3,000 Netherlands NVPI Gold 30,000 New Zealand RIANZ Gold 7,500 Portugal AFP Gold 10,000 Sweden IFPI Gold 20,000 Switzerland Platinum 40,000 United Kingdom BPI Platinum"The BPI database" 300,000 United States RIAA 2× platinum 2,500,000 == References == Category:Jennifer Lopez albums Category:2002 albums Category:Hip hop albums Category:Soul albums Category:R&B; albums Category:Epic Records albums
